data.content:
The game was very fun, I love everything about hill climb racing. The maps, the cars, the challenges.

However the new tunnel and mine maps have been ill designed. The maps are biased to cars such as monster trucks who are tall enough to get on top of the stationary mine carts. However if you use the race car you will find your self unable to continue the map.

Frankly I find these new maps to be a annoyance for than a happy addition to the game. Because when ever I see these maps pop up I know It's a loss as my car constantly gets stuck. It has nothing to do with speed or power. The simple fact is the car is unable to get on top of the carts or over certain rocks do to their height.

Please fix these issues so the game can be enjoyable again

data.content:
The game starts off great. The physics engine is cool and runs smoothly. The spine of the game is there but it requires improvements. Different game modes like time trails or stun maps to make the most out of the motorbikes. The city map needs fixing, using the monster truck is a real issue going through the crates. 

The main issue is the money. The average jump I do earns 4 coins, winning races in the legend league earns 150 coins. How is it possible to earn the money needed to upgrade the vehicles between the 3/8/24 hours spent waiting for the cup boxes to open? I understand it's to make people buy gems but seriously if you don't have money to spend you leg behind other players massively. 

Overall it's a brilliant game but the money making scheme is there for all to see.

Fun in small doses but nowhere near as addictive in its simplicity as the first.

data.content:
The game is similar to before so great physics engine which is a joy to use. The graphics are also much better but the problem is that much of the game is taken up with races instead of time trials. Most of these levels are quite dull and short and you don't really feel any sense of accomplishment like you do when you progress on the hillclimbs. You still get hillclimbs as part of the game but it's not as focal as in the first game. 
The main problem though is the scoring system. You seem to be rewarded not for great driving but instead for logging in every 8 hours and claiming a prize, watching a video and claiming a prize or just slogging through levels with no sense of fun at all. The gameplay seems dominated by the developers designing it all around making money which has definitely spoilt a potentially phenomenal game. It's still good but it feels commercial and unoriginal. Still, it's free so you can't really complain.... oops!

data.content:
I do like the game. It's a nice touch to add multiplayer and visual customisation to vehicles, however it doesn't compare to the first game, or at least it didn't compare to the old version...
Money is an absolute pain to get and you find you are repeating the same adventure mode level repeatedly and dying at the same point just to get a small amount of cash. The first game was more rewarding in terms of money, although high end upgrades were expensive and lead to the same issue as this game has, just not as soon as this game.
The other issue I have is with the addition of the "gems" rubbish. I noticed they butchered the first game with this stuff now which is why I mentioned this game isn't as good as the "old version" of the first hill climb. I feel it's just another money grab which ruins the game.
That aside, it does feel fun for the moment. But I'll see what I think with the more I progress in the game
data.title: It's ok, but the old is still better
